Posts.Content: Jump07 wrote: Hi Everyone, i'm one week out of surgery.  feeling a little better as the days go on.  and, may i stress 'little'.  but, that's okay.  at least all of the real big stuff is behind me. i didn't seem to cry too much while this was all in it's preparation stage, but now i have bouts of tears, sometimes sobbing, and i'm not trying to be superwoman or trying to do anything really, i'm just surprised when the tears come. i'm still quite tired a lot.  i'm  not sure what to expect in the 'motivation' dept.  any thoughts? my nodes ended up clear.  yahoo.  that was the next hurdle.  but, i am very lucky.  chemo appt. next week. just wanted to say hi to everyone and thank everyone for all their posts to my questions/concerns. i know i will still need you guys as things go on.  you've been a great support system for me. (the tears are flowing....) thanks again, everyone. Jump ps. any suggestions on how to get the tape residue off my body.  it is so strong.  tried baby oil, nail polish remover. Dx 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Hi Everyone-It's Jump/I'm back.... Jump07 shrink

Posts.Content: Jump07 wrote: Hi Everyone, Well, my day is almost here.  I've been able to mask my fear by not really paying attention to all that is going on with me.  I know I will be okay and y'all have helped me so much. What do you think I should have on hand, at home, when I finally get there?  Certain clothes, availability of everyday things.  How did everyone's first shower go?  Please share with me all that you know, good or bad.  I know it would only help me. I'm only have a mast on left breast, will I be able to use my right arm somewhat freely?  I'm hoping it will be of great help to me. Mom and sister in law will be around to help me, but any and all info/suggestions/advice to help me thru this will be so, so appreciated. Love, Jump xoxo Dx 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2007 05:23PM Jump07 wrote: Dear Pearl- I am very sorry to hear of your situation.  I just echo what the other ladies are saying: please reach out to us and to anyone around you, that you can.  And, yes, I agree w/Tender, maybe a little bit of medication will help you with all this overwhelming stuff.  I'm not into just popping anything for any symptom, but it sounds like you could use a little help, my friend.  I will keep you in my thoughts and prayers. Please keep us posted, as we are all concerned. Jump

Posts.Content: Dec 22, 2007 05:48PM Jump07 wrote: Bessie- I can't thank you enough for your last response.  There is soooo much to read and figure out that sometimes its so overwhelming.  Every picture tells a story and that diagram you sent is super. I have an appt soon w/my surgeon. I'm going to take that with me along with your info.  It really has grounded me and I think my decision for a 2nd opinion is valid, but I'm going to wait to talk to her.  Hopefully I won't offend her.  That's my concern with the 2nd op.-even though I know it shouldn't be because it's my body. thank you, thank you. Love, Jump
Posts.Title: 2nd opinion? please, please help.... Jump07 Hope_M

Posts.Content: Jump07 wrote: Hi Ladies- You've helped me before, and I really need your opinions again. I am 44, my pathology report reads : ductal carcinoma in situ * cribriform type w/nuclear grade 1-2 of 3 * no definite lymphovascular space inv. identified * left breast only * right breast completely clear * no cancer in my family, I'm the first one. I honestly feel this is the truth.  I know this is cancer.  I believe the doctors/med. prof. that have seen my info are giving me the facts. I am scheduled for a unilat on Jan.10. My friends sister works in the medical field.  She wants me to see a doctor that she "believes in", in regard to treatments.  Do I need to doubt anything about the cancer I have and the treatment (masectomy) that has been discussed. The whole thing is a bummer to begin with and I'm stressing out trying to get copies and films to go see the 2nd guy and it's not going smooth for me.  Part of me just wants to continue down the path that I believe is supposed to be followed per all the tests so far, and the other part is, what, hoping for other news?  My head is spinning at the fork in the road, which way to go.  Can anyone of you guys help me.....? Any and all info will be so appreciated. Jump07 Dx 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
